results.title: More Screen Time Linked to Delayed Development in Babies, Study Finds
results.abstract: One-year-olds exposed to more than four hours of screen time a day experienced developmental delays in communication and problem-solving skills at ages 2 and 4, according to a new study
org_facet: Journal of the American Medical Assn

media.caption: The research also found that 1-year-olds exposed to more screen time than their peers showed delays at age 2 in the development of fine motor and personal and social skills.
